rules: Rule1: Under the condition that a violation is detected in paper1, whenever paper1 is peer-reviewed, then paper1 is not plagiarized.
Rule2: Provided automated detection by tool1 is applied to paper1, if a plagiarism check is conducted on paper1, then a violation is detected in paper1.
Rule3: Either automated detection by tool1 is applied to paper1 or manual detection by person4 is applied to paper1.
Rule4: If manual detection by person4 is applied to paper1, then whenever a plagiarism check is conducted on paper1, a violation is detected in paper1.
Rule5: Under the condition that an internal review is conducted for paper1, if an investigation is initiated for paper1, then paper1 is not compliant.
Rule6: Either an internal review is conducted for paper1 or an external audit is conducted for paper1.
Rule7: Either paper1 is approved by all, or if an external audit is conducted for paper1, then under the condition that an investigation is initiated for paper1, paper1 is not compliant.
Rule8: If an editorial board review is conducted for paper1, then an appeal is reviewed for paper1.
Rule9: Provided an ethics committee review is conducted for paper1, if it is not the case that rejection of paper1 implies non-publication, then an appeal is filed for paper1.
Rule10: If paper1 has a copyright issue, then permission is not granted for paper1.
Rule11: Either paper1 has a copyright issue, or an editorial board review is conducted for paper1, or an ethics committee review is conducted for paper1.

Rule12: Whenever a legal department review is conducted for paper1, if it is not the case that a copyright issue in paper1 implies permission is granted, then the copyright issue for paper1 is resolved.
Rule13: Either a legal department review is conducted for paper1 or a publisher review is conducted for paper1.
Rule14: Provided a publisher review is conducted for paper1, if it is not the case that a copyright issue in paper1 implies permission is granted, then the copyright issue for paper1 is resolved.
Rule15: If major revision is required for paper1, then minor revision is required for paper1.
Rule16: If a new submission is required for paper1, then resubmission is allowed for paper1.

Rule17: Under the condition that a quick decision is made for paper1, if it is not the case that the absence of approval or the condition that peer-reviewed implies non-plagiarism leads to major revision, then a new submission is required for paper1.
Rule18: Either a quick decision is made for paper1 or a thorough review is conducted for paper1.

Rule19: Provided a thorough review is conducted for paper1, if it is not the case that the absence of approval or the condition that peer-reviewed implies non-plagiarism leads to major revision, then a new submission is required for paper1.
Rule20: If a fast-track process is applied to paper1, then an expedited review is conducted for paper1.
Rule21: Either a fast-track process is applied to paper1 or a standard process is applied to paper1.
Rule22: Whenever a standard process is applied to paper1, if paper1 is peer-reviewed, then paper1 is not plagiarized.
Rule23: Under the condition that a managing editor review is conducted for paper1, if an expedited review is conducted for paper1, then paper1 is approved.
Rule24: Provided an associate editor review is conducted for paper1, if an expedited review is conducted for paper1, then paper1 is approved.
Rule25: If person2 is the author of paper2, then paper1 is not published.
Rule26: Either person2 is the author of paper2 or person3 is the author of paper2.
Rule27: Either paper1 is immediately rejected, or a managing editor review is conducted for paper1, or an associate editor review is conducted for paper1.
Rule28: If a policy violation has occurred for paper1, then paper1 is not immediately rejected.
Rule29: Whenever a formal report is issued for paper1, if an investigation is initiated for paper1, then paper1 is not compliant.
Rule30: If the case for paper1 is closed, then the documentation for paper1 is not incomplete.
Rule31: If person3 is the author of paper2, then paper1 is not published.
Rule32: Either paper1 is plagiarized or paper1 is a valid submission.
Rule33: If an editorial check is performed on paper1, then paper1 is approved.
Rule34: Either an editorial check is performed on paper1 or a plagiarism check is conducted on paper1.

Rule35: If it is not the case that complete documentation for paper1 implies an informal report or the condition that an external audit implies a formal report, then the documentation for paper1 is incomplete.
Rule36: If it is not the case that paper1 is approved or the condition that peer-reviewed implies non-plagiarism, then minor revision is not required for paper1.
Rule37: If it is not the case that the absence of valid submission implies non-authorship by person1 leads to submission acceptance, then paper1 is published.
Rule38: If paper1 is not a valid submission, then person1 is the author of paper1.
Rule39: If paper1 is not a valid submission, then paper1 is compliant.
Rule40: If paper1 is not a valid submission, then an investigation is initiated for paper1.
facts: Fact2: A policy violation has occurred for paper1.
Fact3: The documentation for paper1 is complete.
Fact4: The case for paper1 is closed.
Fact6: It is not the case that paper1 is approved by all.
Fact7: It is not the case that paper1 has been accepted for submission.
Fact8: It is not the case that an appeal has been filed for paper1.
Fact9: It is not the case that an appeal has been reviewed for paper1.
Fact10: It is not the case that the copyright issue for paper1 is resolved.
Fact11: It is not the case that resubmission is allowed for paper1.
Fact12: It is not the case that an informal report has been issued for paper1.
Fact13: It is not the case that paper1 is approved.
